title: Head of a Nobleman
description:
Red granite head and part of right shoulder of male statue with short echeloned wig; practically neckless. Nose damaged; full face; sharp eyebrows; upper eyelid rim plastic. No trace of back pillar although upper portion of back is preserved below wig. 
Condition: Good, except that nose is partly lost, and mouth is slightly chipped. Top of head is worn.
dimensions:
8 1/2 x 9 x 6 in. (21.6 x 22.9 x 15.2 cm)
mount ((m1 dimensions as installed)): 8 1/2 × 9 × 6 in., 15 lb. (21.6 × 22.9 × 15.2 cm)

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: These two heads from ka-statues (the tomb statue that received food and drink offerings) demonstrate the different properties of granite and limestone. Granite is harder than limestone, so it takes a higher polish and allows the artist to carve finer detail. Though both statues gave the deceased’s ka a place to receive offerings, the granite would have been the more desirable statue.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: To Live Forever: Egyptian Treasures from the Brooklyn Museum
